metadata.title: CVE-2017-12104 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: An exploitable integer overflow exists in the way that the Blender open-source 3d creation suite v2.78c draws a Particle object. A specially crafted .blend file can cause an integer overflow resulting in a buffer overflow which can allow for code execution under the context of the application. An attacker can convince a user to open the file or use the file as a library in order to trigger this vulnerability.

criterions.comment: blender package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.79+dfsg0-1').
